entry.title: [GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/SBG5/WAW1/SGP1/BHS5/SYD1/DE1/UK1/VA1/OR1][Public cloud]]End of life for Kubernetes1.20
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 21, 08:00 UTC  -  Mar 23, 17:00 UTC

Jan 4, 02:05 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 21/03/2023 08:00 UTC
End time : 23/03/2023 17:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact except for the apps that do not support the new version (1.21).
Service improvement : The aim of this maintenance is to upgrade deprecated clusters to a supported newer version (1.21).

Jan 30, 22:40 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 13/03/2023 01:00 UTC
End time : 26/03/2023 23:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact is expected for business and enterprise plans, a small downtime may be experienced for essential plans (less than 15mn).
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an upgrade of our MongoDB offer.

entry.title: [Lim][Public Cloud/Object storage] - vRack
entry.content:
Jan 30, 23:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 30, 21:52 UTC
Verifying - Verification is currently underway for the maintenance items.

Jan 30, 21:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 30, 13:47 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 30/01/2023 21:00 UTC
End time : 30/01/2023 23:00 UTC
Service impact : For GET/HEAD on existing objects:
-10% of objects could be unavailable (latency or 503 instead of 200) - Only 1 replica available out of 3.
-1.5% of objects will be unavailable (503 instead of 200)
For GET/HEAD on non-existing objects:
-10% of objects could answer 503 instead of 404
for PUTs:
-10% of objects may encounter disturbances.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on a network equipment.

-2% of objects might be unavailable (latency or 503 instead of 200)
-0.4% of objects will be unavailable (503 instead of 200)
for PUTs:
-slowdowns to be expected on 2% of traffic

entry.title: [BHS5/DE1/GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/SBG5/SGP1/SYD1/WAW1/UK1/US-EAST-VA-1/US-WEST-OR-1][Containers & Orchestration] - Possibility to upgrade kernel nodes version by using the security update (patch) policy
entry.content:
Jan 30, 16:51 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 30, 10:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 27, 09:30 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 30/01/2023 10:00 UTC
End time : 30/01/2023 17:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As described in our public roadmap (https://github.com/ovh/public-cloud-roadmap/issues/259), this maintenance is scheduled to provide to the MKS users the possibility to update their Managed Kubernetes Services. This release will rollout/rebuild the Kubernetes nodes onto a GNU/Linux kernel in version 5.4 (based on the Ubuntu kernel linux-image-generic-hwe-18.04).
Additional information: All new delivered nodes will be installed with this new GNU/Linux Kernel version.

entry.title: [BHS/GRA][AI] - Notebooks/Training/Aps
entry.content:
Jan 30, 15:01 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 30, 15:00 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 26/01/2023 13:27 UTC
Service impact : You can't currently create an AI workload with a attached PCS volume using the manager. Workaround is to use the CLI, APIv6 or Regional API.
Ongoing actions : Investigating
